qas.question: What color gowns are generally worn by recent Doctors of Philosophy at Oxford?
What good traits is the color red associated with in China?
In what century did Saint Nicholas become the influence for red being worn by Santa Claus?

answers.text: the Greek Christian Bishop of Myra

qas.question: What color to brides wear in Christian countries?
Who was the 4th century Santa Claus in Turkey?
What color gowns are worn on red carpets?
What do all Doctors of Philosophy wear?

context: <b5_0>Red<b5_0/> is the color most commonly associated with joy and well being. It is the color of celebration and ceremony. A red carpet is often used to welcome distinguished guests. Red is also the traditional color of seats in opera houses and theaters. <a0_0><b7_0><b8_0>Scarlet<b7_0/><a0_0/> academic gowns<b8_0/> are worn by new Doctors of Philosophy at degree ceremonies at Oxford University and other schools. In China, it is considered the color of <a1_0>good fortune and prosperity<a1_0/>, and it is the color traditionally worn by brides. In Christian countries, it is the color traditionally worn at Christmas by Santa Claus, because in the <a2_0>4th<a2_0/> century the historic Saint Nicholas was <a3_0>the <b6_0>Greek Christian Bishop of Myra<b6_0/><a3_0/>, in modern-day <a4_0>Turkey<a4_0/>, and bishops then dressed in red.
